radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is normal in echotexture without focal lesion, intra or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The common bile duct measures 5-6 mm. A 14 mm gallstone is seen in the gallbladder neck and does not move with repositioning. The gallbladder is not particularly distended nor is there a mural thickening or pericholecystic fluid. The pancreas is normal. The aorta is normal in caliber throughout its course. The imaged IVC is unremarkable. Single-view of the right kidney is without hydronephrosis. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow.
